website_summaries.verdict: As durable as it is cute, an extra layer of material helps to make this fuzzy elephant last longer for extra value.
pros: Strong construction, and it includes a squeaker
Extra soft and snuggly toy for small to medium sized breeds
2 size options to be easy to play with for puppies and smaller breeds
cons: Best for cuddles, not for hardcore chewers

customer_reviews.title: Another great Kong toy for my dog
customer_reviews.text: My Maltese loves little toys he can carry around with him and try to get the squeaker out - this toy fit the bill! It's small and lightweight, so that he can take it wherever he wants (upstairs, my bed, etc). He's been digging and chewing to get the squeaker for days now and no small holes have formed like in similar toys. This is a very well-made product. Please click "yes" if helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous to dogs
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived in good condition and is cute looking. It didn't last more than 5 mintues before my 7 year old terrier mix ripped into it. But the worst part was that she vomited after playing with it on two separate occasions. The first time plastic came out of her so I could understand. So, the next time she played with it, we monitored her carefully and made sure that she didn't swallow any of it. As soon as she de-stuffed it, we threw it out. That night, she vomited again. This is the last time I'll ever buy this product again!
customer_reviews.author: AL

customer_reviews.title: Very Disappointing - Shedding Plastic Hair Everywhere - Lower Quality than Previous Versions
customer_reviews.text: I had to take this away from my dog. In outsourcing all this to China, KONG is putting profit first and our beloved pets last. We had a green alligator version of this toy in the same size and it has lasted a long time. But, something must have been changed in the manufacturing, because this one is just constantly losing short brown plastic fur. Unintentionally, our dog is ingesting that fur, so this toy is a NO GO. Haven't returned it yet, but will seek a new company to buy toys from. Like most US companies, KONG has sold us out for profit. Just more Chinese garbage here.
customer_reviews.author: AnthonyNYC

customer_reviews.title: Elmer Is A Must Have For Our Pug
customer_reviews.text: Our four year old Pug has had both the medium and the small Elmer and she loves both of them. We have had two of the small ones and this is the third medium. They do hold up pretty well until she finally rips the throat open and tears out the stuffing. But she just loves them even though she has a toy box full of toys. So when she ripped Elmer's throat out, I just had to get a replacement. The Elmer Family is her favorite "fetch" toy. As soon as my son comes out of his room, she immediately gets one of the family and drops it at his feet ready to play.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon

customer_reviews.title: Our dogs just love this toy
customer_reviews.text: Our dogs just love this toy, they are fascinated with it I had to see how they would react to it so I originally only bought one well they liked it so much that I had to purchase another one, they are not a chew toy so you have to make sure you supervise your dogs with it and make sure that they do not try to rip the stuffing and the squeaker out, at night we put the toys up so the dog's can not get them, in the am when they see these up they bark and want them. Highly recommended toy for dog's but you must not let your dog play with this unsupervised.
customer_reviews.author: Don Wilkinson

customer_reviews.title: really inconsistent manufacturing results
customer_reviews.text: hair fibers began coming off this product almost immediately after my dog put it in his mouth. the polyester hairs came off easily, even if I tugged at them and they ended up in his mouth. So I threw it out when I noticed that. What is strange is that I have "Kong Kozie" moose. (This is the rabbit.) My dog has been chewing the moose for over two months and the moose has not been shedding hair. So I'm really unhappy with the hit or miss nature of the manufacturing. I shouldn't have to police these products so that my dog doesn't ingest polyester from a factory in China.
customer_reviews.author: JimTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: 2 months with an aggressive chewer and it's still squeeking
customer_reviews.text: Squeeky toys don't usually last long. This was given to my 85 pound aggressive chewer dog and it's still in pretty good shape about 2 months later. She did chew off the ears but it was well sewed so no harm. She also chewed off the tail, I did have to resew the tushy area but it's still going strong after that. This is her favorite toy, I will try to get her other Kong toys like this now that I know they will last longer than most. They are her favorite toys to play with.
customer_reviews.author: K. Schumacher

customer_reviews.title: NOT A CHEW TOY !!! Use only for light chewers as stated on the package...
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy if you dog is a chewer. It came this morning and within 10 minutes my 9 month older German Shepard had the toy Moose's stomach torn open , the squeaker out, and my living room looked like it was covered in a inch of fluff! Really surprised me because usually the kong toys last and last... I know the package states for light to moderate chewers, but come on 10 minutes... My dog has a few other chew stuffed toys and they are beat up but not destroyed.
customer_reviews.author: Al Skorich

customer_reviews.title: Good for all but power chewers.
customer_reviews.text: Elmer the Elephant was a decent plush toy while he lasted. The medium size is probably ok for most sized dogs since I would imaging a small dog can still carry it around but it still cannot get swallowed whole by large dogs. Our 55lb black lab Shelby is quite the prolific toy destroyer; poor old Elmer was disemboweled in minutes and the remaining plush fabric was not too durable either. Best bet: If you know your dog is a chewer / destroyer, skip this and buy a Tuffy. If your dog on the other hand will care for this as if it were their own miniature pink baby elephant, than it will be worthwhile to buy. Good luck.
customer_reviews.author: James C.

customer_reviews.title: Long lasting plush toy
customer_reviews.text: Like Marvin the Moose and his predecessors, I'm sure Rosie the Rhino will eventually end up as a giant pile of stuffing in my backyard sooner or later, but as for now, she is fighting the good fight and surviving my two dogs. The squeaker in these Kong Cozies is harder to squeak and it's not a very 'good' squeak, which honestly probably helps my case because the dogs are less motivated to shred her apart and get the coveted squeaker out to chew up. I'm happy with how the Kong Cozies have held up in terms of being a plush toy, and will buy another when this one is inevitably destroyed.
customer_reviews.author: K. WyattTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Pretty sturdy little toy.
customer_reviews.text: Like all stuffed animals, I don't expect it to hold together forever. That being said, I think this is a very sturdy toy. It took almost a month before my German Shepherd/Hound mix got the ears and tail off it, which is pretty good considering he can usually shred a normal toy in a matter of hours. Even with the ears and tail gone, he still can't get the stuffing out of it, so the toy is still definitely usable. They are sewn well and have much thicker material than most dog toys. These are definitely worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: cute toy for smaller dogs
customer_reviews.text: nice toy, cute looking monkey. Nice for smaller dog to play fetch or cuddle with. Probably not a good choice for dogs that chew/eat up toys. I purchased this for my parents dog (adopted maltese). He likes to cuddle with it. He will put it in his bed. If you take it out, he will put it back in. If you put any other toys in his bed, he will take them all out except for the monkey. For some reason he really seems to like this little monkey. Genergally speaking, I usually like Kong products and this one is no different. I would recommend to a friend or purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Raoul Duke online shopperTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Great Plush Toy
customer_reviews.text: My boxer loves this! She carries it everywhere around the house and sleeps with it too. I've tried getting her other soft toys but they never last longer than a month. Kong plush toys always last her for about a year. So, we stick with this brand now. This toy has been one of her favorites. She tosses it up in the air and runs to grab him. It's fun to watch. The toy is well made and looks exactly like the image.
customer_reviews.author: nq

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good chew toy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my newly adopted 1 year old pit mix puppy. The first thing he did was chew off an ear. However, the ears are sewn on very well and it did not explode the toy. The squeker is not overly loud. He loves to chew on this , toss it around and and so far so good. No sure how long it will last, but for now, we are happy with it. He actually has two of these toys, a green hippo and this blue dog.
customer_reviews.author: Kase

customer_reviews.title: Good toy for comfort
customer_reviews.text: This is my dog's comfort moose, so we put this in the crate with him when we have to go somewhere. He gently chews on it and will tuck it up under himself when we're gone. We did this on purpose, so he would have a comforting toy. He doesn't play with this out at all, but it's good for puppies who need a little friend. He has not chewed through it, but I think that's by choice, because we made it to be his "bye-bye" toy.
customer_reviews.author: Ribbin E.

customer_reviews.title: KONG pink elephant dog toy
customer_reviews.text: I'm speaking from my dog (malti-tzu) because this is her most favorite toy. She could be the sentimental type but this was one of two of very first toys we gave her when we first brought her home at 3 months old. She is now 1 yr 9 mo. and she still plays with her little elephant. The ears have been chewed on quite a bit but I think she's taken this as her safety blanket. When I tell her to "get your toy", this is the toy she goes and looks for around the house and she knows where to find it!
customer_reviews.author: teresa

customer_reviews.title: My lab's absolute favorite toy and great quality
customer_reviews.text: My lab loves stuffed animals of all kinds, but this has been his favorite since I bought it for him a year ago for Christmas. This is invariably the first one he picks up and wants to play with. We bought the X-Large size and while I thought it would be too big for him when it arrived, he thinks it's perfect. Have washed and dried it numerous times and played tug-of-war with it regularly, but it has not come apart anywhere. The squeaker stopped working after several washes, but I expected that.
customer_reviews.author: BettinaH

customer_reviews.title: Great toy
customer_reviews.text: My mini-Aussie LOVES this toy! He begs for us to throw it for him in the living room & it’s the only toy we will throw inside the house! He will also do what we call a dance with it, where he throws it around & shakes it very forcefully! It’s quite a spectacle! We actually got this one as a backup for his original, which, after 3 years, is finally starting to show signs of age. Very good toy, well constructed, as you would expect from Kong!
customer_reviews.author: Solomon Robin

customer_reviews.title: First day, our toy monger chewed a couple of holes in it.
customer_reviews.text: We have a female Schnauzer who LOVES toys, she plays with her toys constantly. As a result, we often find them completely destroyed, shredded to fluff. We bought this hoping it would live up to the Kong reputation and last a while but it only made it part of the first day. She really loved playing with it and was using it as a pillow when not running around the house with it, but now it sits awaiting repairs. My advice is buy multiple inexpensive toys for your "chewers" instead of paying a premium for Kong, they'll last longer.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn N

customer_reviews.title: Nice size for my 80-90lb hunting type dog
customer_reviews.text: Nice size for my 80-90lb hunting type dog! I've trained my last dog also to take care of their babies & don't hurt them! My 2nd of the same breed(known to tear all to pieces,loves her babies & squeaks & sleeps w/as many as she can fit in her bed! She tore it a little & is waiting for me to sew it up & put an extra squeaker inside.! I have 5 to patch up,but worth it! Tough with all the squeaking she does w/them! Kong are my favorite & last longest before a tear happens! I bought a bag of replacement squeakers to have on hand!!
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Garten

customer_reviews.title: Durable Plush KONG Toy  - Great for Large Breeds that Chew
customer_reviews.text: Our belgian malinois puppy LOVES this toy. It does have a squeeky but puppy doesn't seem to be able to get to it as easily as in other toys. After 2 weeks, toy is still in great shape and squeeky still works. He gets to sleep with this toy every other night, but otherwise, access is restricted to supervised playtime to ensure maximum life of toy. We also have the Kong Bear with knotted rope inside which is another favorite. In terms of plush toys, puppy likes these KONG toys the best.
customer_reviews.author: lizr79

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Buy!
customer_reviews.text: Ok, so I bought a couple of these Kong Cozie's for my dogs for Christmas and they are by far the best "flufflies" I've ever invested in. They are both still intact, have all their fluffing, all appendages still attached even after tug of war AND the squeakers still work. They got them on Christmas Eve. I'm very impressed! I have a very berserk Border Collie who usually destroys fluffies in less than 5 minutes and an English Setter.
customer_reviews.author: Tam2dogs

customer_reviews.title: LOVE this Toy !!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a favorite toy for sure ! My senior boy who never played with a toy in his life turned out to be an aggressive toy chewer. Kashi is a rescue boy and never played with toys until I got a rescue puppy Ping who loves toys so now Kashi & Ping fight over all the toys but this toy has stood up to the constant chewing. There are a few holes in it but they are still able to play with it due to it hasn't fallen apart like most toys in the first 5 minutes ! Kong toys are the only toys that last in this house! Love this toy and will be ordering more !
customer_reviews.author: Jacqui

customer_reviews.title: indifferent dog loves this toy for some reason
customer_reviews.text: My son's dog doesn't care much for toys. But the dog loved the squeeky blue-dog toy. The dog "loved" the first one to shreds over the course of several months. I was delighted when I found that I could get a replacement. The dog was genuinely excited when I got the new one out of the delivery box. This is the first item I ever "paid extra" (about $2.50) for next-day delivery. Really glad I did. It made me really happy to see the dog instantly enjoy the replacement as much as the one that was coming to pieces.
customer_reviews.author: Gary J

customer_reviews.title: The toy that lasts forever
customer_reviews.text: The BEST BEST BEST dog toy ever. It looks pretty, color and shape choices are great. The most important thing is it LASTED so longggg. Nothing has ever lasted that long for my dog. I tried everything, even the 50$ toy won’t last a day with my dog. Only Kong toy lasts for years. I did have to sew up some holes in the belly of the toy but all the limbs are intact throughout the years, which is incredible. Highly recommended!!!!
customer_reviews.author: DLe

customer_reviews.title: A well loved Monk!
customer_reviews.text: Winchester has had this monkey since we rescued him when he was a puppy. Monk has been on many adventures and has traveled to many places. Winchester takes Monk to bed with him and likes to show him off to visitors. Sometimes he forgets him in the back yard tho and when we ask him where his Monk is, he has to go search for him. 😕 Monk is well loved and sometimes turns into crusty Monk. Then Winchester has to wait for Monk to get washed and dried. All that love and adventure everyday for 3 years.. Monk is starting to show some wear. I bought backups. 😉 #dogmom #itssilly #butimnotsorry
customer_reviews.author: Jackie

customer_reviews.title: Sorry KONG, this time you failed us.
customer_reviews.text: I love the KONG brand, but not this time. Although the monkey was cute and fuzzy, the sqeaker was defective and didn't work at all. When I give my dogs a toy, the first thing they look for is the sqeaker. They couldn't find it this time and immediately shredded it hoping to find the sweet spot to listen to their favorite noise. I really wanted to love this toy as much as I've loved the other KONG toys, but I can't. Sorry KONG, this time you failed us.
customer_reviews.author: Robi K.Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: My dog loves it.
customer_reviews.text: I have a small bichon/poodle mix that thinks he's a piranha. Every toy he gets he chews and rips until he rips the heart out (the squeaky plastic inside). He takes all the stuffing out and leaves a mess everywhere. When I received this toy, he was so excited. He proceeded to attack it and commence his biting/chewing routine. Lo and behold... its been 6 days so far and he still can't rip it open. This is the longest time he's ever had a toy without destroying it!! Yippee!!!! Thank you :-)
customer_reviews.author: J. Lu

customer_reviews.title: Belgian Malinois NOT approved - Not durable at all - Strong Chewers look elsewhere
customer_reviews.text: Belgian Malinois - Not Approved. So Leo utterly destroyed this toy in under 24 hours. Kong has made a GREAT Harness however their toys of which I bought 2 of (see Kong Squeezz Bone Dog Toy here:) and BOTH are horrible products for my Leo whom is a Belgian Malinois. I am determined to find a quality product and so far Kong is loosing it on the toy product line. I am already considering another toy from West Paw product line as their ball has lasted longer than the 18 pack of tennis balls, and all the fresbies combined including the Nerf rubber one (also a horrible purchase).
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Dale Pleis III

customer_reviews.title: Absolute favorite toy
customer_reviews.text: This gator is my German Shepard’s favorite toy on earth! It was his first toy when we adopted him and brought him home from the shelter. It was live at first sight and they have been inseparable since! He carries it everywhere and cries for it if he can’t get to it. This is our second gator after 2 years of constant love, tugging and chewing. If your dog loves it half as much as Jack does, they will be a very happy dog.
customer_reviews.author: Amy2007

customer_reviews.title: Kong is usually great, but my little one tore this to shreds.
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves "babies" that have squeakers. She will bite them all over in search of the squeaker, then find and rip it out. It is game to her. Baby guts all over the room until she gets that squeaker. The great thing about the Kong brand, is they are well made, usually. I have like 4-5 others and this is the first that she "killed" within about 5-10 minutes of having it. I had purchased it a while back (I do my shopping early) and saved it as a Christmas gift, so it was past the return date. I didn't think it would be an issue seeing that all my other Kong babies had survived.
customer_reviews.author: T & T

customer_reviews.title: SMALL PERFECT SIZE FOR YORKIE
customer_reviews.text: My little 6-pound 2-year-old Yorkie loves the little baby lion. Perfect size for her small mouth. She plays with it every day picking it out among her other toys. She likes to play fetch and keep away with the lion and can actually find the squeaker in the lion which makes her happy. Squeak, squeak, see mommy, aren't I smart making the lion squeak.
customer_reviews.author: BlueWaterBlonde

customer_reviews.title: Xmas gifts for my doggies!
customer_reviews.text: I've bought several toys for my dogs and they ALWAYS! Destroy it and take the squeaker out. Not this time! Since then, both of the toys, the monkey and crocodile have been through thick and thin rug of wars, been thrown across the yards, rooms, garage and chewed like no other! And not one stitch has ripped! Aside from being g filled with slaber and spit they are awsome!
customer_reviews.author: Katkiller13Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Lasted longer than most
customer_reviews.text: Took awhile for my Italian Greyhound to even create a rip in this guy. I know, small dog, but she's got quite a set of teeth and destroys toys pretty quickly. This one has held out well and only in the last week or so has the stuffing started to show. I'm used to stitching up her toys, but the fact that this has lasted since Christmas rather than just a few weeks is mighty impressive. Oh, but she did destroy the squeaker quickly. But those never last more than a few days in my experience and is a given.
customer_reviews.author: LuxEtVeritas

customer_reviews.title: Great toy, one of my pup's favourites.
customer_reviews.text: My pup loves her KONG Rosie the Rhino toy. She's a 40 pound hound-something mix rescue and medium is a perfect size for her. She managed to chew off the tag (she loves tags on everything so I let her chew them) and then the tail which was a bit of a worry but that too did pass. She hasn't been able to remove the squeaker (unlike her KONG Marvin the Moose which she gutted almost immediately). We loved it so much we got once for her cousin who loves her's too. This toy is tough and holds up well to CONSTANT squeaking. I wish Marvin could say the same.
customer_reviews.author: Michele Ann

customer_reviews.title: He Loves It, But...
customer_reviews.text: Our 9-month old, massive lab puppy loves his moose. He has since Day-One. He sleeps with Moose and chews on moose - that being the major issue with Moose. He's a extreme chewer and has already gone through the tag and tail. We figure it has another week or two before a leg or head comes off and it goes bye-bye. It's not a tug-toy, but it is a great cuddle toy.
customer_reviews.author: Lee

customer_reviews.title: No squeak
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased several Cozie toys for my 15 lb Shih Tzu mix and she loves them all. I gave her "Baily the Blue Dog" yesterday, only to find that it didn't squeak, which ruined the fun of stalking and attacking brand new "prey." I couldn't very well take it away from her, so I'm stuck with a defective product. Very surprising as this was extremely well packaged. Perhaps vacuum sealing was a bit too much?
customer_reviews.author: JJTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Not as advertised!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for our seven month labor doodle and it only lasted three days before coming apart. I bought the Kong teddy bear and a red bird that lasted two weeks. My puppy tore these apart tearing off the head exposing the red plastic ball inside and had to be thrown away. He has also tried the blue octopus and out of four tentacles their is only one left. The only Kong toy that has lasted so far is the small and large interactive hard rubber cones and the intense black dog bone. I am done buying Kong soft sqeeky toys as they are not worth the money if you have a bigger dog.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: WHENEVER I RECEIVE AN ORDER FROM AMAZON, MY LITTLE ...
customer_reviews.text: WHENEVER I RECEIVE AN ORDER FROM AMAZON, MY LITTLE DOG ALWAYS THINKS THERE'S SOMETHING FOR HER. JUST NOW, I GAVE HER THIS ELEPHANT, BUT EVEN SHE WAS DISAPOINTED! THE SQUEEKER IS SO PUNY AND WEAK AND SHIFTS AROUND, WHERE HER LITTLE MOUTH CAN'T SQUEAK IT. SHE KEEPS BRINGING IT TO ME TO "FIX IT." I WAS HOPING THE EXTRA LAYER WOULD PREVENT HER FROM TEARING UP THE TOY TO GET TO THE SQUEAKER, BUT AS IT IS, AFTER A COUPLE OF MINUTES OF TRYING TO MAKE IT SQUEAK, SHE JUST GIVES UP.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren M. Drew

customer_reviews.title: Takes a licking (and biting)
customer_reviews.text: These add-on items are addicting. I couldn't help but think - hey, my puppy doesn't have a monkey toy. Seriously, I had that thought. The "Spunky the Monkey" toy is now her favorite (for now). It's definitely well-made, and looks durable enough to stand up to the torture that my small dog inflicts on all of her possessions. She goes through many toys, so this high quality Kong product gives me some peace of mind as I don't find fuzz everywhere on my floors. The medium is a perfect size for my 10 pound terror. Wonderful toy for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Kevin RTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Great Variety of Well-Priced Toys
customer_reviews.text: In general, I love the Kong Cozie Collection. They are great quality, very cute, and super affordable. They have a good squeaker and my dog loves all the little littles and ears and tails on each of the toys. My only problem with this toy is that my pup destroys them in like a day and she is only 20 lb. I have to rotate them out once she breaks into the initial fluff, but this is not really the makers fault because she basically destroys all of her toys. Still, the Kong Cozie toys generally last longer than the other brands of toys and they are a great price!
customer_reviews.author: RyanTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Long lasting, good quality
customer_reviews.text: It’s been over a month and my dog hasn’t been able to destroy the squeaker yet. Ingenious that the squeaky bit is sewn into another pocket like it’s doubly reinforced. He’s chewed the ears off and has removed a lot of the stuffing trying to get to the squeaker but hasn’t been able to “kill” it yet. This toy is still a favorite. Would buy again considering any other squeaky toy we’ve purchased lasted less than a few hours.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Puppy Love It - Parent Cleans Up After It
customer_reviews.text: No sooner did I open my package did my dog leap for her new furry friend! She’s an 8-week old 3 pound Cheagle and though the toy is near as big as she is, she loves it! She especially enjoys the elephant trunk because she’s teething. Greatest negative is that the pink fuzz falls out with aggressive chewing. You should definitely be with your dog when they’re playing with it. Overall a great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: ESR

customer_reviews.title: The eyes didn't make it through the first few minutes..
customer_reviews.text: I Wanted this to be sturdy.. and the body probably is.. but those eyes sticking up were too much for my lab/Dalmatian to resist.. He is a heavy chewer.. LOVES the stuffed animal to death.. in minutes.. Going to sew the holes shut and hope it lasts longer without parts to trigger his "chew it off" desire..
customer_reviews.author: wolfriend

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 5 minutes with a 12 pound dog
customer_reviews.text: I love Kong stuffed toys as well as Kong rubber chew products. We have one stuffed toy that has lasted for 5 months. This one did not last 5 minutes. Literally. Photo shows that my 12-lb Boston terrier ripped a hole the size of a silver dollar in the thing within minutes of getting it.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Twain

customer_reviews.title: She had fun carrying the little monkey around the house
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my 35 lb. Cocker Spaniel mix. I would consider her an "average chewer," not an aggressive chewer. She had fun carrying the little monkey around the house, showing it off. But when she laid down and starting chewing on it, the "squeaker" came out after about 5-10 minutes (she started chewing on just the squeaker, so I threw that part away.) After another 10 minutes the rest of the stuffing was out of the monkey. She still carries around the monkey's empty corpse and seems entertained with that, but I definitely wouldn't spend money on another one of these.
customer_reviews.author: sam

customer_reviews.title: Indestructible And Lovely!
customer_reviews.text: These are the BEST dog toys, period. My French Bulldog doesn’t like chews, rawhide, ropes, balls, bones, nada. He only likes plushie toys. However, he destroys them easily. All the KONG plushies are wonderful and never rip or lose shape. I throw them in the laundry when they get stinky and then every year I’ll get a new one. My baby likes to sleep with them and sometimes falls asleep with them in his mouth. Thank you KONG!
customer_reviews.author: Claire Poirot

customer_reviews.title: Really liked this toy and it held up surprisingly well
customer_reviews.text: Really liked this toy and it held up surprisingly well, and I have a pit bull puppy who loves to chew, and she loves this thing. It is very durable for a stuffed toy. The Horn on the rhino seemed to be not sewn on quite as strong, and that was the first, well actually only thing to come off. After the horn was ripped off she was able to get to the stuffing and so I had to remove it. Overall pretty happy with this purchase though and the price isn't bad at all! I will be trying a different variation of this toy, hopefully they all don't have a weak spot like the horn on this rhino!
customer_reviews.author: JahRebel RastafariTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, tough material...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this thinking it would be soft enough for my dog to play with but it’s a bit too tough. Ideal perhaps for an aggressive chewer which my dog is not. Should’ve known better as it’s made by Kong but that’s my fault, not theirs. With this in mind, I rated this item with 5 stars because it is of good quality and is worth the money for anyone, as stated above, with an aggressive chewer.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Durable and cute
customer_reviews.text: Kong toys definitely have lasted us the longest with our 7-month old puppy, and they are one of the few dog brands that make toys that are nice for the humans to look at also. They look basically like heavy duty versions of something I would probably buy my kids. Our dog seems to fixate on whatever the tiniest piece to chew on is. On these Kong plushes, it seems to the be tail he loves the most, but even with him carrying it around and chewing, and playing tug of war, even those tiny pieces stay on and intact pretty well. Definitely good durability and aesthetics for the money.
customer_reviews.author: koyangi

customer_reviews.title: Not very durable
customer_reviews.text: I bought the moose based on the reviews. My Border Collie loves to squeak and shake her toys but she doesn't really tear holes in them for a long time, if ever. But with this one, she tore the back out in just a week. I'm not sure why this one was different than her other toys. I don't think it's worth the extra money.
customer_reviews.author: K in Durham

customer_reviews.title: Lone Survivor
customer_reviews.text: I bought this 2 years ago for my chocolate lab. She was about 6 months at the time, and has had this toy since then. We've since gotten a new dog, a 2 year old German shepherd, and they have efficiently destroyed an entire laundry baskets worth of toys. This kong lamb is the lone stuffed survivor. I'm very impressed with how the little guys held up and will be ordering more toys.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha

customer_reviews.title: I have Boston Terriers
customer_reviews.text: Boston Terriers are notorious for destroying toys and we have bought SO MANY and our girl just destroys them in moments. But this one... she still has her old bunny that is earless now but the fact that the body is still intact six months later is amazing to us. Kong stuffed toys will be the only toys we buy from here on out for our puppies.
customer_reviews.author: Carla M. Beland

customer_reviews.title: Cute, but not for chewers
customer_reviews.text: We got this because we had gotten other KONG toys. In fact, I am pretty sure we had this same exact one. It took our pup probably six months to get to the point where he had destroyed it, but this one only lasted about a month. It just doesn't hold up to the chewing. If your pup does not chew as much as actually play with these, then I feel like this, and similar toys would be great to have. However, with any sort of chewer, it is just throwing money down the drain on top of constantly having to pick up stuffing.
customer_reviews.author: Kay-Dee AgonoyTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Is This Really a Kong Brand Toy?
customer_reviews.text: Awesome toy, almost. My 14 week old Australian Shepherd loved the elephant, but destroyed it in less than a hour total of play time. My dog bit the tail off in one bite. The tusks took maybe two or three bites each. He's teething so biting is his thing, but he's never destroyed a stuffed toy so easily. I gave it three stars because he loved the feel and size right off the bat. He still cries when he see it and wants it back. We have stuffed toys that he's been unable to destroy, so I'm confident that it isn't just my dog is too rough. Oh well, my kids have destroyed toys just as fast.
customer_reviews.author: hotboater2

customer_reviews.title: Hardly Held Together, Stuffing Everywhere
customer_reviews.text: Dog still enjoys the shell of the toy, but immediately all the stuffing fell out. I literally handed it to the dog and it was falling out as he ran off. Upon further inspection the bottom was not stitched at all, a small thread barely holding it together. Usually have good experiences with KONG toys, but I guess we got a lemon. tossed out the stuffing/exposed sqeaker and he still chews on/plays with it so it's not a total loss I guess.
customer_reviews.author: wes

customer_reviews.title: Well made and a favorite
customer_reviews.text: I gave this toy 5 stars because my large breed LOVES it! For whatever reason, he took to it immediately. He carries it everywhere including outdoors. He sleeps with it under his head. Really cute! So far it is in perfect shape. I don’t know if it would hold up to chewing.
customer_reviews.author: Mary R.

customer_reviews.title: I had high hopes for this adorable toy. My puppy went straight for the sewn ...
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for this adorable toy. My puppy went straight for the sewn in tag on the but of the moose. Once she chewed the tag, she was able to pull out the squeaker and all of the fluff. This poor moose only lasted three days in my house....
customer_reviews.author: HaemorTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: My 3 year old Aussie loves these toys
customer_reviews.text: My 3 year old mini Australian shepherd loves these Kong toys! This one was a bit smaller than I expected, but ended up being perfect for my 30 pound pup! He carries it all over, takes it to bed with him, and throws it around and squeeks it like crazy all the time. He has had it since his birthday which was in April, it is now almost October and this little purple rhino is still alive and well lol which is more than I can say for half the toys I've bought him. They usually get destroyed pretty quick, but not these ones. He now has 3 of these mini Kong toys, all of which he loves!
customer_reviews.author: Sea516

customer_reviews.title: BUY IT!
customer_reviews.text: I love any toy Kong makes! These are especially great. I use Kong toys for my foster dogs and even though the brand is a bit pricey, it's totally worth it! I am a bit OCD about clean toys so I try to stay away from stuffed toys but these stand up in the wash really well so they can stay clean and they last forever!
customer_reviews.author: Sallie

customer_reviews.title: Would totally buy again!
customer_reviews.text: We recently adopted another dog. I bought a bunch of toys and bones for her because we didn't know what she would like. This is by far her favorite toy! She doesn't go anywhere without it. She won't go in her crate unless she's got it and when she leaves her crate she takes it with her. She hasn't tried to destroy it like other toys. She just seems to take it around like it's her baby. It seems like a really good quality and she wouldn't be able to destroy it even if she tried. I got it as an add on item so it was quite affordable.
customer_reviews.author: ChinersTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Cute and durable
customer_reviews.text: These Cozies are adorable and the medium size is perfect for my 45-lb beagle mix. I like that there are no protruding small plastic parts on the exterior (eyes, etc.) that a dog could bite off and swallow--everything is embroidered. My dog's normally an aggressive chewer and will rip apart most stuffed animals within 20 minutes. These, for some reason, he doesn't try to rip. He still chews, and loves the squeaky sound they make, but they're both still intact after several days of playing. I also got the Moose version and switch them out once in a while to keep things interesting.
customer_reviews.author: Tess

customer_reviews.title: Great toy for my great dane mix
customer_reviews.text: This is a great toy for my great dane mix! He is an average chewer of toys, and the first thing to go from this Marvin Moose was the tail. Very little, if any, stuffing was removed from this incident. After having this toy for my pup for about 2 months, it is still good to go! I'm very impressed with the durability of this toy for its price. If this toy falls apart, I will definitely order another.
customer_reviews.author: WhoElse

customer_reviews.title: Not the best toy by Kong
customer_reviews.text: I expected a little more since it was Kong toy. I have a puppy corgi, not even a year old, he chewed a whole into the toy under two weeks. I gave an extra star because maybe the toy was more for basic fetch and playing and would last under different circumstances. But my dog is a puppy and this gator was still toast. I still love other Kong products but not this one
customer_reviews.author: Elijah Velazquez

customer_reviews.title: Lasted longer than other plush toys!
customer_reviews.text: While it only lasted a few months, the Kong plush toys last much longer than any other brand we've tried with our puppy who LOVES to chew and destroy anything! I don't mind purchasing a new Kong plush toy every few months, because I know it's more durable and safer than others. Plus it's cute! :)
customer_reviews.author: Micalla L. Davis

customer_reviews.title: Lasting fun!
customer_reviews.text: We only buy Kong Cozie stuffed toys for our 80-lb Labrador Retriever. This is Cozie #5 our Lab. They are durable, shakable, lickable, snuggle-able, and last for years. Purple Rhino was ordered for her 3rd birthday present and she’s never destroyed any of the other 4 we’ve ordered, when other stuffed toys are easily unstuffed.
customer_reviews.author: Mamalight

customer_reviews.title: I ordered Buster the Squirrel, however I received Buster ...
customer_reviews.text: I ordered Buster the Squirrel, however I received Buster the Koala instead. I'm not sure if this was due to an error by the Amazon order picker or if the listing simply misidentifies a koala as a squirrel (the Kong label clearly indicates "Buster the Koala"). Anyhow, my dog loves these little guys (we've had two Marvin Moose). When the stuffing starts coming out and the squeaker stops squeaking (usually after about 24 hrs), I just remove it all and he still enjoys dragging around and chewing on the empty shell/carcass, which is durable enough to stay intact for a few weeks before I sneak and toss it in the trash when he's not looking.
customer_reviews.author: Tim-A

customer_reviews.title: Kaptain's favorite toy
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves this toy - he has a box full but this is the only one he carries around in his mouth every day. When we tell him to pick a toy for a car ride, he always goes to this. I find it in my bed in the morning because he jumps up with it and leaves it there when he falls asleep. I've ordered 3 so far and will continue to order more as they rip apart.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Kirkwood

customer_reviews.title: but other than that it's been great. I had sworn off getting stuffed toys of ...
customer_reviews.text: The one I got didn't have a squeaker or it didn't work which was very disapointing, but other than that it's been great. I had sworn off getting stuffed toys of any kind for my dog because in less than 30 minutes he would have it torn open and I would have to take it away from him. This lasted weeks before he started getting a leg bitten off, and although now all of the legs are off the rest of the toy is still intact and one of his favorite toys.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect and durable if your dog does not need the squeaker
customer_reviews.text: I do not hate the item, but my pug does :( If your dog likes the squeakers, definitely stick to the medium or large versions of this product. I bought two of the smaller ones for my pug because he would have trouble getting on the bed with the medium one. Unfortunately, the squeakers are very hard for him (or any of my other three dogs) to squeak and he will not have anything to do with them. Although he still absolutely LOVES the medium version!! Product is still very durable and is perfect if your dog does not need the squeaker.
customer_reviews.author: gojunebug

customer_reviews.title: Love, Love, Love this toy
customer_reviews.text: This is our puppy's favorite toy. The squeak didn't work very well but that made it all the better for us since we keep it in our bedroom for her to sleep with. She loves playing with it by herself and will bring it to us so we can play with her. She is quite a chewer and so far this toy has stood up quite well.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda

customer_reviews.title: so far...This is great!
customer_reviews.text: We have a English bulldog. she wont be 2 years old until June. she loves a stuffed animal! So far this one has survived ! she Loves it and really gives it a workout. Chewing, tugging and shaking it. have not had a toy last longer than a week, LOVE this Kong stuffed animal and no hole or lost stuffing!!!
customer_reviews.author: BethAnn

customer_reviews.title: Medium is still pretty small, but dog loves it!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely so adorable! My year old rescue loves this little stuffie. He’s so gentle with his Elmer and brings it everywhere with him. I will definitely be buying the other ones!! (My dog isn’t normally the type to “completely destroy” toys, he normally will eat ears off, tails, etc but keeps them in tact. With Elmer, he hasn’t ripped any of the “extremities” off yet but I can see how a tough chewer would demolish this if that is your concern. Still worth the money to me even if it is destroyed!)
customer_reviews.author: Madeline’s Reviews

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last a week
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 55 lb. labradoodle, who is a little over a year old and loves to play! We have a small Kong cozy elephant that has lasted since she was a puppy. This x-large Kong cozy alligator didn't last a week. It tore very easily and is now in the garbage. It didn't work for us, but maybe if your dog just wants to cuddle with a toy and not play tug-of-war or keep away it will work for you.
customer_reviews.author: K. Roever

customer_reviews.title: RIP Rabby the rabbit. Not very durable for chewers as described.
customer_reviews.text: This lasted 5 mins with my boyfriends pit bull mix. I was praying he might love it and not chew it up. I sewed and fixed the bunny up after that and then didnt hurt it for a bit which had me super psyched and happy. Than sadly he ripped out the stuffing a few weeks later slowly. Going to have to toss it soon.
customer_reviews.author: Julia

customer_reviews.title: great choice, xtra fun options
customer_reviews.text: alot of floppy parts that 'hit' at him when it shakes it and squeaker especially fun. when he finally breaks thru cover he will have even more fun pulling stuffing out. (wish they wouldn't try so hard for minimal stuffing - gutting it is the final reward). newly adopted 4yr old shelter dog has a deformed mouth so the appendages on this style makes it easy for him to grasp. stuffing and cover so soft he will fall asleep on it - arms n legs n ears n nose make him feel especially cuddled. glad I chose this toy, especially this style and color. bright pink easy to find in grass lol
customer_reviews.author: bonanaTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality.
customer_reviews.text: Two days. This toy lasted two days before the stitching on the belly came out and turned this toy into something usable. So I got a replacement and within 6 hours the same stitch came out spilling the stuffing out like a thanksgiving turkey. Serious quality control issues.
customer_reviews.author: Bri Ben

customer_reviews.title: Great chew toy for our retriever!
customer_reviews.text: These have proven time and again they are the best toy for our large dog. So many times a toy lasts a few days or a month. These are still going strong a year later. I buy them again and again when they get so tired looking that it requires a replacement but never once has it been chewed up like so many other toys.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: In the Trash at lightening speed.
customer_reviews.text: This was delivered on Saturday. And we had to watch my dog Cash constantly because wit was very clear that he was getting prices off of it. Firstly swallowing the tail. By Thursday the at was ripped off. Decapitation then occurred and the alligator ended in the garbage. When will someone make a snuggly toy that’ll last?
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Like a Blanket to a Baby - Our Puppies love these. MACHINE WASHABLE AND STILL SQUEAKS!
customer_reviews.text: We got this for our Scoodle Puppy. We had no idea that she would love it as much as she does. We got the medium size not realizing that it will be the size of her. But, that does not matter. She loves it. Plus, machine washes great AND it still squeaks. This is a must have for puppies. We will be getting more. ---- We also got the small version of Ali the Aligator for our other Scoodle Puppy​. He too carries it around and sleeps with it like a baby with a blanket. Very pleased with the Kong Line of toys.
customer_reviews.author: RyanTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Ricky loves it.
customer_reviews.text: My 20-lb Shih Tzu carries his pink-and-blue buddy everywhere. He takes his naps with it. This is the second Kong plush toy I've bought him. The first one got loved to death, but it lasted a year which is saying a lot. Good quality. Bright colors. Great service. Reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy toy for the enthusiastic destructive dog
customer_reviews.text: Finally a toy that doesn't disintegrate into a bunch of white fluff within a few hours of being presented to my chew-happy dog. She loves the Kong Cozie, and while they lose their limbs rather quickly, the body hangs on for weeks and is enthusiastically played with. Buying a regular stuffed dog toy is like flushing cash down the toilet with my dog, so I now exclusively buy Kong products
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Skin more durable than the guts
customer_reviews.text: This gator is the largest of its kind I can find and not the most durable, but it is my dogs favorite. This pic is the new on just received and his newest OLD one. First he chews the tail off, usually week one, then a whole in the tummy and there goes the stuffing inside. As far as the actually gator hide is extremely durable. You can play loads of tug of war with it! Why do I keep buying you ask. The excitement on his face when he sees it in the store or pulled out of the box. :)
customer_reviews.author: Chantel

customer_reviews.title: Pitbull, pit bull, staffordshire terrier, shih-tzu, yorkie
customer_reviews.text: We have 3 dogs. 2 shih-tzu miles around 12 pounds and 1 staffordshire terrier (aka pit bull) and these hold up great for the little dogs. They would probably last aka few months if not a year but our pittie chews through to the squeaker within a week. I still give them 5 stars though because I know she is an agressive cheer (she can crunch steak bones into pieces and the only "kong" to last has been the black rubber) and they last 5 days! I just re-stuff them and sew up the hole until the holes get too big. I would recommend these to anyone and have bought them several times now.
customer_reviews.author: Life By Mugs

customer_reviews.title: Way too big for my needs and came in the wrong color.
customer_reviews.text: They sent the wrong color and it was about twice as big as I thought it would be... they kindly offered to exchange it, but it was too late, so I just returned it without any problem. If you got the color you wanted and had something larger than a kitten to give it to, it could be a great toy. I can see a 12 week old puppy absolutely loving this and carrying/dragging it everywhere. If you have a 12 week old Golden Retriever, GO FOR IT!! The problem with the color, by the way, was a mismarking at the factory, it "said" it was the color I wanted, but just wasn't.
customer_reviews.author: Great CookTop Contributor: Coloring

customer_reviews.title: Quality Not as Expected with Kong Name!
customer_reviews.text: Quality Not as Expected with Kong Name! While I certainly did not expect a soft, stuffed toy to be chew-proof, I did wxpect a certain elevated quality with the Kong name. Hence why I purchased over other products that I previously had used for my dogs and that I had been satisfied with. These toys (I also purchased a different animal style) were by far cheaper in quality than any I have purcahsed, including the discount stores, and the squeeker was practically non-existent in both.
customer_reviews.author: Giovanna G.

customer_reviews.title: Lab approved.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my Lab. He is a big puppy at 4 years old, and loves this toy. He loves it so much, he hasn't even tried to destroy it! It still squeaks and he has had it for a month already, which is a record! Usually stuffed toys don't last too long around here! So I would buy it again, if/when he destroys it (or when the smell becomes unbearable. The Lab has a pretty terrible breath ).
customer_reviews.author: Mel

customer_reviews.title: Love love love this gator
customer_reviews.text: Love love love this gator! I have a boxer that can tear up any toy in a matter of minutes. We started with the medium and upgraded to the large because the dog got bigger not because there was anything wrong with the toy. We've had the large for over a year now and have washed it in the washing machine several times. It's finally time to buy a new one as there's a small hole behind the eye, my boxer finally won.
customer_reviews.author: stacy

customer_reviews.title: Being that I have 2 dogs this poor thing became the tug toy
customer_reviews.text: Haha! Once my dogs realized that this "stuffed animal" was fair game it was war time! Being that I have 2 dogs this poor thing became the tug toy, but let me tell you it stood up to them and I have a great dain/lab mix and a sharpie/pit mix, so it holds it own very well! I recommend this one. I only bought one to begin with just to make sure they would like it. Well I should've bought 2 at the time!
customer_reviews.author: Kat Miller

customer_reviews.title: Great toy for large dogs...if they don't chew!
customer_reviews.text: I have three German Shepards and they all love these large toys! My oldest carries it around like her baby. Be warned though if your dog is a chewer they don't stand up well. My 9 month puppy got a hold of one and redecorated my house with the stuffing in a matter of minutes! As a Kong toy I was hoping they would hold up a little better but I still like to buy them for my oldest.
customer_reviews.author: Payton

customer_reviews.title: Oddly enough our pups that are over 65 pounds love these guys
customer_reviews.text: Oddly enough our pups that are over 65 pounds love these guys. They don't last very long a week at most. But they aren't expensive so we love getting them these. We have a boxer/pointer mix 6 years old and a plott hound/lab mix that's 1 year and 8 months. Our dogs play pretty aggressively but some how they have managed keep this toy alive for at least a week.
customer_reviews.author: Living That Dog Life

customer_reviews.title: Edit: Squeaky part stopped working
customer_reviews.text: Edit on 1/10/20 The store these were offered through Amazon was not helpful at all. So, I contacted Kong and they had me pick out two different toys for my dog, and had them here within a week. I am very impressed with the Kong company, and will order directly from them for now on. Thank you Kong, for helping me, our dogs are happy!! I ordered two of these, one for each dog. Within 24 hours, the squeaky part stopped working. This is the part they like the best, now they walk right past it. I am very disappointed and would not recommend this if your dog likes the squeaky part.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Baxter loves his pink elephant
customer_reviews.text: This was Baxter’s first toy and it’s still lives after 2 years. It’s been through dozens of washes, outside during rain, and has been played with a lot. Although he has several stuffed Kong toys he seems to like this one the best. It’s easy to play catch with this in the house. Baxter is now 26 months old and I think he deserves a new pink elephant so I am buying another today. Baxter is now 75 lbs Black Lab and just a great dog!
customer_reviews.author: SherryM

customer_reviews.title: One of the best toys I got for my puppy
customer_reviews.text: I got this for a 7 week old Vizsla last July and it lasted till March before it got its first tear. I also have the blue dog and it lasted about the same amount of time. She has had access to these toys nonstop and they have been one of her favorite tugging toys, so they've taken a beating. They never even stopped squeaking, and it isn't an annoying squeak. It's very tolerable. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny Stallion

customer_reviews.title: adorable
customer_reviews.text: I have put this away for a special day----it is so cute. Being that my dog is a chewer i do not know how long this will stay in one piece. The kong bear that is medium was destroyed very quickly that I had given him. He is a Havanese and 14 pounds. The small toys are best for him to carry and shake around. This is a very well constructed toy.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn L.

customer_reviews.title: My dog loves the small Kong toys
customer_reviews.text: Gave this to my little Maltese and he absolutely loved it. He played with it some much and covered it with slobber, that I had to wash it after just 2 days. I'm pretty sure not knowing where his toy went for this two days made him miserable....but he was so excited when I gave it back to him! Please click "yes" if helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Still intact a year later, only the tag was chewed off.
customer_reviews.text: Edit: Two years later, still completely intact and still one of his favorites! Bought the medium sized alligator for my stocky 15 lb cavapoo, it's been exactly a year and the only thing wrong is he chewed off the tag. The rest of the toy is still completely intact, he hasn't even chewed off the ears or tail like he usually does with his toys. He's not exactly an aggressive chewer, but he loves to chew off the little parts that stick out like tags and ears. Something about this alligator has kept him from destroying it! Kong toys are unfortunately hit-or-miss sometimes with quality but they seem to know what they're doing with the stuffed animals.
customer_reviews.author: Heather H.

customer_reviews.title: Not for tough chewers
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for a 7 month old Malinois which removed the arm of the XL moose within 10 minutes....it is almost impossible to find a toy he doesn't destroy, I was hoping this would be more durable due to the Kong name attached. Lesson learned
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: And then he bounced around the back yard with the floppy body happy as could be
customer_reviews.text: Somehow we started calling this Bunny...my dog loves it! It's not exactly a toy any longer as it is a fabric shell of an animal but it's one of his favorites. My dog destroy Bunny in about 30 minutes - stuffing and squeak out. And then he bounced around the back yard with the floppy body happy as could be. I wish there were a way to make cute toys like this for tough dogs. I do think Kong and Nylabone are the best tough toys though. I shouldn't have bought this knowing how quickly he chews through toys. But it was cute and it makes him happy!!
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: FYI, small is REALLY small.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased the pink elephant and moose for my two toy poodles. I didn't expect the toys to be quite so small, but they turned out to be a good size for the dogs. I've added photos as reference. The one with the elephant is 5lbs, the one with the moose is 7.5lbs. In terms of durablilty these toys have stuck around and stood the test of time longer than any other. I believe part of this is because they've had to have some teeth pulled but I'm still impressed these toys aren't torn to shreds yet.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

product_meta.title: KONG Cozies Dog Squeaky Toy
product_meta.description: Size:Small| Color:Elmer the ElephantThe KONG Cozie s are cute, soft and cuddly plush toys made with an extra layer of material, so they’re extra tough. Cozie s are perfect for a game of fetch or as a comfort toy for your furry friend. Grab one of the 10 amazingly cute Cozie characters for your dog and we know your dog will love you for it. Covered by KONG Satisfaction Guarantee. See KONG Satisfaction Guarantee document below for full details.
feature_bullets: Extra layer of material to increase strength
Available in two sizes: S and M

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
